comments:
This has to be the strangest problem I have ever seen with eclipse, and I'm
really not sure where to file it.  Here goes:

Starting with a fresh M6 and a fresh workspace, I somehow managed to get my
runtime workbench into a state where I would get a NoClassDefFoundError whenever
I tried to create a new Eclipse Application launch configuration.  The steps
were as follows:

  1. Run a runtime workbench
  2. Go to Run > Run...
  3. Click on Eclipse Application
  4. Click New
  5. Get an exception with a NoClassDefFoundError

At the time, I had SWT checked out in my workspace.  I closed those two projects
and restarted, but still I got the NoClassDefFoundError.  I created a second
runtime workbench launch configuration, and from within that, I could not
reproduce the error!  The diff between the two launch configuration .xml files
was identical, but from one it would always happen, from the other it never
happened.  I then tried renaming the first launch configuration from "Eclipse"
to "Eclipse y", and then it worked.  I can now no longer reproduce the problem.

Here is the full text of the exception I was getting:

can you zip up the config area for the runtime workbench where all this 
weirdness is taking place?

In the Debug view, right-click on the Process that corresponds to the runtime 
launch config in question.  Bring up the properties.  In the program args, the 
location of the config area is specified via the -configuration arg.

Created an attachment (id=19671)
Configuration area

Note that I can no longer reproduce this, but here is the configuration area as
it currently exists.

Now it has started to happen on my work machine as well.  Could it be something
to do with other plugins accessing SWT classes?

I get a NoClassDefFound error which is triggered by
pde.internal.ui.launcher.WorkbenchLauncherTabGroup:

>   2. Go to Run > Run...
>   3. Click on Eclipse Application

I can reproduce this. Seems indeed very similar to bug #90862.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 90862 ***
